title: "Stop complaining about mobility, you just have to aim your skillshots properly"
body:
[](https://i.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/facebook/000/015/652/230114_908223010.jpg) 
The champion I am supposed to aim at:




https://onesaitama.files.wordpress.com/2016/01/3thrval.gif

replies.body: Stop complaining about being poor, just win the lottery
A politician in my country once literally said, on live TV, "People should just stop complaining about being poor, and just get 2 or 3 more jobs."
How do you get more than 1 job? 1 job as a full-time is literally draining you physically and mentally. I can't imagine having 2-3 jobs.

Like, one job is 8 hours, you get another part time one, that's 12 hours. 2 hours to get to/from home/work, 2 more to eat and do other things, and you still have 8 hours left. What are you complaining about? Even 2 full time jobs still leaves you 4 hour, easy peasy.
depends entirely on the schedule and the location of the job. This is why things like uber are so popular.
Wasn't that in the US?
Not only in the US, no.
4head
Can you uh, loan me a million of a dollar?
Whot, you can't hit something that has 2 dashes, 2 blinks, and a flash? Pfah, scrub.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=GgbNqUAr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-25T14:12:14.145+0000)
>
> Whot, you can't hit something that has 2 dashes, 2 blinks, and a flash? Pfah, scrub.

They just need to aim it on top of themself as that is where the enemy soon will be

this... isnt even a joke.
The best way to deal with mobile champs is wait for the engage and aim your shit on yourself.

Works for Kat, Ahri, Zed.  Only person it doesn't work for is yasuo since skill shots are projectiles so he'll just put windwall on you.

>
> Yeah, and btw the guy in the GIF has true invisibility.

{{champion:84}}{{champion:246}}

I can handle Dashes easier than movespeed buffs.

Trying to hit skillshots on someone running with 500+MS is hell.

{{champion:43}} 
 SPAMMING **E **INTENSIFIES

for me it depends upon the predictions of the opponents or their reaction speed, both are valuable, both can be overcome but still doesn't make it any less hard to hit a champion that goes "here, no over here, i'm here now!"
Wanna see me run to that mountain and back?.... Wanna see me do it again?

> [{quoted}](name=2Charmnot2Charm,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=GgbNqUAr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-25T14:47:02.139+0000)
>
> I can handle Dashes easier than movespeed buffs.
> 
> Trying to hit skillshots on someone running with 500+MS is hell.

https://imgur.com/gallery/f7FdEdG

> [{quoted}](name=2Charmnot2Charm,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=GgbNqUAr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-25T14:47:02.139+0000)
>
> I can handle Dashes easier than movespeed buffs.
> 
> Trying to hit skillshots on someone running with 500+MS is hell.

Can we agree both are an evil that should not exist but rather be limited to an extent?
remember when rammus, hecarim and etc were the only champions that could breach 500 without compromising their build in some way and typically, they lost power for their mobility?
And then the Quinn mini-rework happened.
And then Jhin crits his 4th AA.

> [{quoted}](name=2Charmnot2Charm,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=GgbNqUAr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-25T14:47:02.139+0000) 
>
> I can handle Dashes easier than movespeed buffs.
> 
> Trying to hit skillshots on someone running with 500+MS is hell.

This is such an issue. Having a dash means you get a super fast method of repositioning your champion but that's usually only "once per movement" and its effects is usually less than a second. Having 500+MS for let's say 4 seconds is like a 0 cooldown "dash" in which you can do in any direction and can change that direction whenever you want for 4 entire seconds.

I'd much rather try hit a Lux Q on Lucian or Ezreal than someone like Rammus or Volibear.
The movespeed doesn't even have to last that long, a very short burst of movespeed is enough to juke a skillshot that otherwise would have hit 100%.

Just fire more of them, 
https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/026/513/e85.jpg
its not like they don't lose damage for mobility............oh.

No no no no no, that's not archer, that's Gilgamesh. (Names matter, class is so secondary for this great character.)

Caster Gil is best Gil, soon the rest of the world will see that too.
still an asshole tho
irelia in a nutshell

> [{quoted}](name=ExplodingFist66,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=GgbNqUAr,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-06-25T18:50:43.677+0000)

there FIFY {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
lol, why is this so much more disturbing and eye-tiring than it was in the anime?  XD
Because it's a repeating gif that goes on forever instead of just a few seconds in the anime. :p
I sometimes can't even target hyper-mobile champs with point-and-click abilities.
Yeah, and btw the guy in the GIF has true invisibility.

you kidding?  he has 100% max health true damage and invulnerability!

he can also move so fast that he appears to disappear, but he is still visible

This reminds me of me as Ziggs trying to defend the nexus against 3 super waves with Yasuo............ of course he had 50 minions for infinite dashes, and if I did land a skillshot on him, his shield would protect him and be recharged very quickly anyway. 

Teammate proceeded to say "our mid can't land a skillshot" RIP

How dare you miss your slow ass {{champion:99}} q on a {{champion:157}} 
**Spams ? pings**
Hitting skillshots on dashing enemies is not even the issue. The real problem is chasing them through walls
The fact that it took a meme post to remind me that {{champion:429}} exists says alot about Riot and how they handle some of their champions.

well, when she's meta or standard pick rate, her kit tends to be really annoying to deal with, given the free smite for objectives if she's been attacking it, repositioning and crowd control, even free vision XD

she's like Ashe, but toned up like crazy for combat..so she got nerfed hard
